     383             : /* Long lines can be broken by inserting \\\n (backslash newline) */
     384             : /*  into the line. I don't think this is ever ambiguous as I don't */
     385             : /*  think a line can end with backslash */
     386             : /* UPDATE: it can... that's handled in getquotedeol() below. */

     821             : 
     822             : /* Run length encoding */
     823             : /* We always start with a background pixel(1), each line is a series of counts */
     824             : /*  we alternate background/foreground. If we can't represent an entire run */
     825             : /*  as one count, then we can split it up into several smaller runs and put */
     826             : /*  0 counts in between */
     827             : /* counts 0-254 mean 0-254 pixels of the current color */
     828             : /* count 255 means that the next two bytes (bigendian) provide a two byte count */
     829             : /* count 255 0 n (n<255) means that the previous line should be repeated n+1 times */
     830             : /* count 255 0 255 means 255 pixels of the current color */
     831           0 : static uint8 *image2rle(struct _GImage *img, int *len) {
     832           0 :     int max = img->height*img->bytes_per_line;
     833             :     uint8 *rle, *pt, *end;
     834             :     int cnt, set;
     835             :     int i,j,k;
     836             : 
     837           0 :     *len = 0;
     838           0 :     if ( img->image_type!=it_mono || img->bytes_per_line<5 )
     839           0 : return( NULL );
     840           0 :     rle = calloc(max,sizeof(uint8)), pt = rle, end=rle+max-3;
     841             : 
     842           0 :     for ( i=0; i<img->height; ++i ) {
     843           0 :         if ( i!=0 ) {
     844           0 :             if ( memcmp(img->data+i*img->bytes_per_line,
     845           0 :                         img->data+(i-1)*img->bytes_per_line, img->bytes_per_line)== 0 ) {
     846           0 :                 for ( k=1; k<img->height-i; ++k ) {
     847           0 :                     if ( memcmp(img->data+(i+k)*img->bytes_per_line,
     848           0 :                                 img->data+i*img->bytes_per_line, img->bytes_per_line)!= 0 )
     849           0 :                 break;
     850             :                 }
     851           0 :                 i+=k;
     852           0 :                 while ( k>0 ) {
     853           0 :                     if ( pt>end ) {
     854           0 :                         free(rle);
     855           0 : return( NULL );
     856             :                     }
     857           0 :                     *pt++ = 255;
     858           0 :                     *pt++ = 0;
     859           0 :                     *pt++ = k>254 ? 254 : k;
     860           0 :                     k -= 254;
     861             :                 }
     862           0 :                 if ( i>=img->height )
     863           0 :     break;
     864             :             }
     865             :         }
     866             : 
     867           0 :         set=1; cnt=0; j=0;
     868           0 :         while ( j<img->width ) {
     869           0 :             for ( k=j; k<img->width; ++k ) {
     870           0 :                 if (( set && !(img->data[i*img->bytes_per_line+(k>>3)]&(0x80>>(k&7))) ) ||
     871           0 :                     ( !set && (img->data[i*img->bytes_per_line+(k>>3)]&(0x80>>(k&7))) ))
     872             :             break;
     873             :             }
     874           0 :             cnt = k-j;
     875           0 :             j=k;
     876             :             do {
     877           0 :                 if ( pt>=end ) {
     878           0 :                     free(rle);
     879           0 : return( NULL );
     880             :                 }
     881           0 :                 if ( cnt<=254 )
     882           0 :                     *pt++ = cnt;
     883             :                 else {
     884           0 :                     *pt++ = 255;
     885           0 :                     if ( cnt>65535 ) {
     886           0 :                         *pt++ = 255;
     887           0 :                         *pt++ = 255;
     888           0 :                         *pt++ = 0;              /* nothing of the other color, we've still got more of this one */
     889             :                     } else {
     890           0 :                         *pt++ = cnt>>8;
     891           0 :                         *pt++ = cnt&0xff;
     892             :                     }
     893             :                 }
     894           0 :                 cnt -= 65535;
     895           0 :             } while ( cnt>0 );
     896           0 :             set = 1-set;
     897             :         }
     898             :     }
     899           0 :     *len = pt-rle;
     900           0 : return( rle );
     901             : }
     902             : 
     903           0 : void SFDDumpUndo(FILE *sfd,SplineChar *sc,Undoes *u, const char* keyPrefix, int idx ) {
     904           0 :     fprintf(sfd, "%sOperation\n",      keyPrefix );
     905           0 :     fprintf(sfd, "Index: %d\n",        idx );

    1300           0 :         if ( *pt=='\\' || *pt=='"' )

    1310           0 : static void *SFDUnPickle(FILE *sfd, int python_data_has_lists) {
    1311             :     int ch, quoted;
    1312             :     static int max = 0;
    1313             :     static char *buf = NULL;
    1314             :     char *pt, *end;
    1315             :     int cnt;
    1316             :

    1731        5355 : static void appendnames(char *dest,char *dir,const char *dir_char,char *name,const char *ext ) {
    1732        5355 :     strcpy(dest,dir);
    1733        5355 :     dest += strlen(dest);
    1734        5355 :     strcpy(dest,dir_char);
    1735        5355 :     dest += strlen(dest);
    1736             :     /* Some file systems are case-insensitive, so we can't just */
    1737             :     /* copy the glyph name blindly (else "A" and "a" would map to the same file */

    1739        8941 :         if ( strncmp(name,"uni",3)==0 && ishexdigit(name[3]) && ishexdigit(name[4]) &&

    1742             :             /*  the same as uni00ad -- and it looks ugly */

    1744        1793 :             dest += 7; name += 7;

    1746           0 :                     ishexdigit(name[2]) && ishexdigit(name[3]) ) {
    1747           0 :                 strncpy(dest,name,4);
    1748           0 :                 dest += 4; name += 4;

    2084           0 : FILE* MakeTemporaryFile(void) {
    2085           0 :     FILE *ret = NULL;
    2086             : 
    2087             : #ifndef __MINGW32__
    2088             :     gchar *loc;
    2089           0 :     int fd = g_file_open_tmp("fontforge-XXXXXX", &loc, NULL);
    2090             : 
    2091           0 :     if (fd != -1) {
    2092           0 :         ret = fdopen(fd, "w+");
    2093           0 :         g_unlink(loc);
    2094           0 :         g_free(loc);
    2095             :     }
    2096             : #else
    2097             :     HANDLE hFile = INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE;
    2098             :     for (int retries = 0; hFile == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE && retries < 10; retries++) {
    2099             :         wchar_t *temp = _wtempnam(NULL, L"FontForge");
    2100             :         hFile = CreateFileW(temp, GENERIC_READ|GENERIC_WRITE, 0, NULL,
    2101             :             CREATE_NEW, FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TEMPORARY|FILE_FLAG_DELETE_ON_CLOSE, NULL);
    2102             :         free(temp);
    2103             :     }
    2104             :     ret = _fdopen(_open_osfhandle((intptr_t)hFile, 0), "wb+");
    2105             :     if (ret == NULL && hFile != INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
    2106             :         CloseHandle(hFile);
    2107             :     }
    2108             : #endif
    2109           0 :     return ret;
    2110             : }
    2111             : 
    2112             : 
    2113             : /**
    2114             :  * Read an entire file from the given open file handle and return that data
    2115             :  * as an allocated string that the caller must free.
    2116             :  * If any read or memory error occurs, then free string and return 0.
    2117             :  * FIXME: Use a better method than fseek() and ftell() since this does not
    2118             :  * play well with stdin, streaming input type files, or files with NULLs
    2119             :  */
    2120           0 : char* FileToAllocatedString( FILE *f ) {
    2121             :     char *ret, *buf;
    2122           0 :     long fsize = 0;
    2123           0 :     size_t bread = 0;
    2124             : 
    2125             :     /* get approximate file size, and allocate some memory */
    2126           0 :     if ( fseek(f,0,SEEK_END)==0 && \
    2127           0 :          (fsize=ftell(f))!=-1   && \
    2128           0 :          fseek(f,0,SEEK_SET)==0 && \
    2129           0 :          (buf=calloc(fsize+30001,1))!=NULL ) {
    2130             :         /* fread in file, size=non-exact, then resize memory smaller */
    2131           0 :         bread=fread(buf,1,fsize+30000,f);
    2132           0 :         if ( bread<=0 || bread >=(size_t)fsize+30000 || (ret=realloc(buf,bread+1))==NULL ) {
    2133           0 :             free( buf );
    2134             :         } else {
    2135           0 :             ret[bread] = '\0';
    2136           0 :             return( ret );
    2137             :         }
    2138             :     }
    2139             : 
    2140             :     /* error occurred reading in file */
    2141           0 :     fprintf(stderr,_("Failed to read a file. Bytes read:%ld file size:%ld\n"),(long)(bread),fsize );
    2142           0 :     return( 0 );
    2143             : }
    2144             : 
    2145             :

    3004           1 : static void SFDirClean(char *filename) {
    3005             :     DIR *dir;
    3006             :     struct dirent *ent;
    3007             :     char *buffer, *pt;
    3008             : 
    3009           1 :     unlink(filename);           /* Just in case it's a normal file, it shouldn't be, but just in case... */
    3010           1 :     dir = opendir(filename);
    3011           1 :     if ( dir==NULL )
    3012           2 : return;
    3013           0 :     buffer = malloc(strlen(filename)+1+NAME_MAX+1);
    3014           0 :     while ( (ent = readdir(dir))!=NULL ) {
    3015           0 :         if ( strcmp(ent->d_name,".")==0 || strcmp(ent->d_name,"..")==0 )
    3016           0 :     continue;

    3018           0 :         if ( pt==NULL )
    3019           0 :     continue;
    3020           0 :         sprintf( buffer,"%s/%s", filename, ent->d_name );

    3022           0 :                 strcmp(pt,GLYPH_EXT)==0 ||
    3023           0 :                 strcmp(pt,BITMAP_EXT)==0 )
    3024           0 :             unlink( buffer );

    3026           0 :                 strcmp(pt,SUBFONT_EXT)==0 ||
    3027           0 :                 strcmp(pt,INSTANCE_EXT)==0 )

    3029             :         /* If there are filenames we don't recognize, leave them. They might contain version control info */
    3030             :     }
    3031           0 :     free(buffer);
    3032           0 :     closedir(dir);

    3035           1 : static void SFFinalDirClean(char *filename) {

    3039             :

    3118           3 : int SFDDoesAnyBackupExist(char* filename)
    3119             : {
    3120             :     char path[PATH_MAX];
    3121           3 :     int idx = 1;
    3122             : 
    3123           3 :     snprintf( path, PATH_MAX, "%s-%02d", filename, idx );
    3124           3 :     return GFileExists(path);
    3125             : }
    3126             : 
    3127             : /**
    3128             :  * Handle creation of potential implicit revisions when saving.
    3129             :  *
    3130             :  * If s2d is set then we are saving to an sfdir and no revisions are
    3131             :  * created.
    3132             :  *
    3133             :  * If localRevisionsToRetain == 0 then no revisions are made.
    3134             :  *
    3135             :  * If localRevisionsToRetain > 0 then it is taken as an explict number
    3136             :  * of revisions to make, and revisions are made
    3137             :  *
    3138             :  * If localRevisionsToRetain == -1 then it is "not set".
    3139             :  * In that case, revisions are only made if there are already revisions
    3140             :  * for the locfilename.
    3141             :  *
    3142             :  */
    3143           4 : int SFDWriteBakExtended(char* locfilename,
    3144             :                         SplineFont *sf,EncMap *map,EncMap *normal,
    3145             :                         int s2d,
    3146             :                         int localRevisionsToRetain )
    3147             : {
    3148           4 :     int rc = 0;
    3149             : 
    3150           4 :     if( s2d )
    3151             :     {
    3152           1 :         rc = SFDWrite(locfilename,sf,map,normal,s2d);
    3153           1 :         return rc;
    3154             :     }
    3155             : 
    3156             : 
    3157           3 :     int cacheRevisionsToRetain = prefRevisionsToRetain;
    3158             : 
    3159           3 :     sf->save_to_dir = s2d;
    3160             : 
    3161           3 :     if( localRevisionsToRetain < 0 )
    3162             :     {
    3163             :         // If there are no backups, then don't start creating any
    3164           3 :         if( !SFDDoesAnyBackupExist(sf->filename))
    3165           3 :             prefRevisionsToRetain = 0;
    3166             :     }
    3167             :     else
    3168             :     {
    3169           0 :         prefRevisionsToRetain = localRevisionsToRetain;
    3170             :     }
    3171             : 
    3172           3 :     rc = SFDWriteBak( locfilename, sf, map, normal );
    3173             : 
    3174           3 :     prefRevisionsToRetain = cacheRevisionsToRetain;
    3175             : 
    3176           3 :     return rc;
    3177             : }
    3178             : 
    3179             : 
    3180           3 : int SFDWriteBak(char *filename,SplineFont *sf,EncMap *map,EncMap *normal) {
    3181           3 :     char *buf=0, *buf2=NULL;
    3182             :     int ret;
    3183             : 
    3184           3 :     if ( sf->save_to_dir )
    3185             :     {
    3186           0 :         ret = SFDWrite(filename,sf,map,normal,true);
    3187           0 :         return(ret);
    3188             :     }
    3189             :

    3191           0 :         sf=sf->cidmaster;
    3192           3 :     buf = malloc(strlen(filename)+10);
    3193           3 :     if ( sf->compression!=0 )
    3194             :     {
    3195           0 :         buf2 = malloc(strlen(filename)+10);
    3196           0 :         strcpy(buf2,filename);
    3197           0 :         strcat(buf2,compressors[sf->compression-1].ext);
    3198           0 :         strcpy(buf,buf2);
    3199           0 :         strcat(buf,"~");
    3200           0 :         if ( rename(buf2,buf)==0 )
    3201           0 :             sf->backedup = bs_backedup;
    3202             :     }
    3203             :     else
    3204             :     {
    3205           3 :         sf->backedup = bs_dontknow;
    3206             : 
    3207           3 :         if( prefRevisionsToRetain )
    3208             :         {
    3209             :             char path[PATH_MAX];
    3210             :             char pathnew[PATH_MAX];
    3211           0 :             int idx = 0;
    3212             : 
    3213           0 :             snprintf( path,    PATH_MAX, "%s", filename );

    3478      322853 : static int Dec85(struct enc85 *dec) {
    3479             :     int ch1, ch2, ch3, ch4, ch5;
    3480             :     unsigned int val;
    3481             :

    3484       86791 :         if ( ch1=='z' ) {
    3485        2075 :             dec->sofar[0] = dec->sofar[1] = dec->sofar[2] = dec->sofar[3] = 0;
    3486        2075 :             dec->pos = 3;
    3487             :         } else {
    3488       84716 :             while ( isspace(ch2=getc(dec->sfd)));
    3489       84716 :             while ( isspace(ch3=getc(dec->sfd)));
    3490       84716 :             while ( isspace(ch4=getc(dec->sfd)));
    3491       84716 :             while ( isspace(ch5=getc(dec->sfd)));

    3494       84716 :             dec->sofar[2] = val>>16;
    3495       84716 :             dec->sofar[1] = val>>8;

    3497       84716 :             dec->pos = 3;
    3498             :         }

    3503           4 : static void rle2image(struct enc85 *dec,int rlelen,struct _GImage *base) {

    3514           0 :     break;

    3657         406 : static void SFDGetTtfInstrs(FILE *sfd, SplineChar *sc) {
    3658             :     /* We've read the TtfInstr token, it is followed by a byte count */
    3659             :     /* and then the instructions in enc85 format */
    3660             :     int i,len;
    3661             :     struct enc85 dec;
    3662             : 
    3663         406 :     memset(&dec,'\0', sizeof(dec)); dec.pos = -1;
    3664         406 :     dec.sfd = sfd;
    3665             : 
    3666         406 :     getint(sfd,&len);
    3667         406 :     sc->ttf_instrs = malloc(len);

    3835       10036 : static int SFDCloseCheck(SplinePointList *spl,int order2) {

    3837       19941 :             RealNear(spl->first->me.x,spl->last->me.x) &&

    3854        3174 : static void SFDGetHintMask(FILE *sfd,HintMask *hintmask) {

    3861        3759 :             ch -= '0';

    3863        3267 :             ch -= 'a'-10;
    3864        3174 :         else if ( ch>='A' && ch<='F' )
    3865           0 :             ch -= 'A'-10;

    6130       10805 : static SplineChar *SCDuplicate(SplineChar *sc) {
    6131       10805 :     SplineChar *matched = sc;
    6132             : 
    6133       10805 :     if ( sc==NULL || sc->parent==NULL || sc->parent->cidmaster!=NULL )
    6134           0 : return( sc );           /* Can't do this in CID keyed fonts */
    6135             : 
    6136       10805 :     if ( sc->layer_cnt!=2 )
    6137           1 : return( sc );
    6138             : 
    6139       25179 :     while ( sc->layers[ly_fore].refs!=NULL &&
    6140        7142 :             sc->layers[ly_fore].refs->sc!=NULL && /* Can happen if we are called during font loading before references are fixed up */
    6141        4329 :             sc->layers[ly_fore].refs->next==NULL &&
    6142        2126 :             sc->layers[ly_fore].refs->transform[0]==1 && sc->layers[ly_fore].refs->transform[1]==0 &&
    6143        2043 :             sc->layers[ly_fore].refs->transform[2]==0 && sc->layers[ly_fore].refs->transform[3]==1 &&
    6144        1081 :             sc->layers[ly_fore].refs->transform[4]==0 && sc->layers[ly_fore].refs->transform[5]==0 ) {
    6145         374 :         char *basename = sc->layers[ly_fore].refs->sc->name;
    6146         374 :         if ( strcmp(sc->name,basename)!=0 )

    6322             : /* When we recover from an autosaved file we must be careful. If that file */
    6323             : /*  contains a character that is refered to by another character then the */

    6912             :     /* In a sfdir a directory will either contain glyph files */
    6913             :     /*                                            subfont dirs */
    6914             :     /*                                            instance dirs */
    6915             :     /* (or bitmap files, but we don't care about them here */
    6916             :     /* It will not contain some glyph and some subfont nor instance files */

    6918             :     DIR *dir;

    7433             : 
    7434          36 : void SFD_GetFontMetaDataData_Init( SFD_GetFontMetaDataData* d )
    7435             : {
    7436          36 :     memset( d, 0, sizeof(SFD_GetFontMetaDataData));
    7437          36 : }
    7438             : 
    7439             : /**
    7440             :  *
    7441             :  * @return true if the function matched the current token. If true
    7442             :  *         is returned the caller should avoid further processing of 'tok'
    7443             :  *         a return of false means that the caller might try
    7444             :  *         to handle the token with another function or drop it.
    7445             :  */

    9141           0 : static SplineFont *SlurpRecovery(FILE *asfd,char *tok,int sizetok) {
    9142             :     char *pt; int ch;
    9143             :     SplineFont *sf;
    9144             : 
    9145           0 :     ch=nlgetc(asfd);
    9146           0 :     ungetc(ch,asfd);
    9147           0 :     if ( ch=='B' ) {
    9148           0 :         if ( getname(asfd,tok)!=1 )
    9149           0 : return(NULL);
    9150           0 :         if ( strcmp(tok,"Base:")!=0 )
    9151           0 : return(NULL);
    9152           0 :         while ( isspace(ch=nlgetc(asfd)) && ch!=EOF && ch!='\n' );
    9153           0 :         for ( pt=tok; ch!=EOF && ch!='\n'; ch = nlgetc(asfd) )
    9154           0 :             if ( pt<tok+sizetok-2 )
    9155           0 :                 *pt++ = ch;
    9156           0 :         *pt = '\0';
    9157           0 :         sf = LoadSplineFont(tok,0);
    9158             :     } else {
    9159           0 :         sf = SplineFontNew();
    9160           0 :         sf->onlybitmaps = false;
    9161           0 :         strcpy(tok,"<New File>");
    9162             :     }
    9163           0 :     if ( sf==NULL )
    9164           0 : return( NULL );
    9165             : 
    9166           0 :     if ( !ModSF(asfd,sf)) {
    9167           0 :         SplineFontFree(sf);
    9168           0 : return( NULL );
    9169             :     }
    9170           0 : return( sf );
    9171             : }
    9172             : 
    9173             : /**
    9174             :  * Asks the user whether or not to recover, skip or delete an autosaved file.
    9175             :  * If requested by the user, this function will attempt to delete the file.
    9176             :  * @param [in] filename The path to the autosaved file.
    9177             :  * @param [in,out] state The current state.
    9178             :  *                 state&1: Recover all. state&2: Forget all.
    9179             :  * @param [out] asfd Location to store the file pointer to the autosaved file.
    9180             :  * @return true iff the file is to be recovered. If true, asfd will hold the
    9181             :  *         corresponding file pointer, which must be closed by the caller. If
    9182             :  *         false, asfd will hold NULL.
    9183             :  */
    9184           0 : static int ask_about_file(char *filename, int *state, FILE **asfd) {
    9185             :     int ret;
    9186             :     char *buts[6];
    9187             :     char buffer[800], *pt;
    9188             : 
    9189           0 :     if ((*asfd = fopen(filename, "r")) == NULL) {
    9190           0 :         return false;
    9191           0 :     } else if (*state&1) { //Recover all
    9192           0 :         return true;
    9193           0 :     } else if (*state&2) { //Forget all
    9194           0 :         fclose(*asfd);
    9195           0 :         *asfd = NULL;
    9196           0 :         unlink(filename);
